SUPERFLUOUS.Definition: more than what was needed, unnecessary

EYE-OPENING.Definition: something that will be surprising and will make them see things differently

COBBLED.Definition: made of round stones or bricks

SCALES.Definition: a device used to measure weight

TO THEIR HEART’S CONTENT.Definition: as much as they wanted, until they were satisfied

OBESITY.Definition: the condition of being very overweight

OBESE.Definition: very overweight to an unhealthy level

PLAGUED.Definition: troubled or affected for a long time

THEORETICALLY.Definition: according to an idea or theory, not necessarily in practice

DIABETES.Definition: a disease where the body has trouble handling sugar in the blood

ABDOMEN.Definition: the belly or stomach area of the body

HALLELUJAH.Definition: an expression of great joy or praise

WORD SPREAD.Definition: the news or information was shared with many people

MUSIC TO THEIR EARS.Definition: something very pleasing or satisfying to hear

WAISTLINES.Definition: the measurement around the waist (stomach area)

IRRESPONSIBLE.Definition: not showing care or thought for the possible effects of actions

SURPRISE SURPRISE.Definition: an expression used when something expected happens, often sarcastically

SEDENTARY.Definition: involving little or no physical activity

CLICHE.Definition: an overused idea or phrase that has lost its original impact

LOBBYISTS.Definition: people who try to influence politicians or government decisions

PALMS BEING GREASED.Definition: people being given money to do something dishonest

JOGGERS.Definition: people who run at a slow pace for exercise

WAISTS.Definition: the part of the body around the stomach area

CONTROVERSIAL.Definition: something that causes disagreement or debate
